Text.Value: It's simple - you need me. Don't pretend otherwise.
Fine. I will assign Flesh to aid you on your way. Ring this bell...

EditorData.AnimationTags: Reaches behind his back for the bell  <DAN>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Reaches behind his back for the bell

Text.Value: Fine, if it'll spare me your bleating. The relic lends the General his strength, his invulnerability. It must be recovered, before his enemies attempt to exploit it.
Interesting - let's test that theory. Time to die, monster.
Words - even my words - are woefully insufficient. When you see for yourself, you will understand.
Now, given your prying nature, I have work for you, as a scout.

EditorData.NodeContext: First sentence: dreamily waxing lyrcial about Nightsong. Second sentence: down to business.

Text.Value: I'm not helping. You trespassed in Lady Shar's temple - this is a problem of your own making.
This sounds like your problem, not mine.
While you, an infinitely more humble servant, fulfil my command. I will put you to work - as a scout.
All right, I'll help you find the Nightsong - and yes, I know more about this 'relic' than you realise.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player knows about Nightsong via Balthazar's research, but didn't previously reveal it.

Text.Value: Because I'll rip your tongue out, shove it down your throat, then stomp on your 'creations' until they are dirt beneath my feet.
Ah, it was you who pulled his sorry carcass from the rubble. You should have left him there.
*The thought eludes you. Perhaps you saw a passing reference in some old tome.*
...Fine. I'll forgive your transgressions this time - there are much grander things at stake.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Squints at the player, considering, before speaking.
EditorData.NodeContext: A pause before 'fine' - weighing up the player's fate.

Text.Value: The relic is close, but the way is barred and Shar's dead are... uncooperative. Clear the path for me - by blade, cunning, or whatever it takes.
Do it - unleash your creations. But they will not protect you from me - or my righteous fury.
Enough unpleasantries. You're Balthazar, yes? Z'rell sent me, to ensure you didn't fail your master.
Ah, the interloper - and in one piece as well. Not an entirely unpromising specimen, for one naturally-born.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Balthazar looks up from an altar <DAN>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar looks up from an altar repurposed as a surgical table of sorts. One of his undead warriors, damaged, lies upon it.
EditorData.NodeContext: Begrudging and largely hostile, but with a hint of appreciation for the player's skill in actually making it this far.

Text.Value: What do you need me to do?
Keep it - this is your problem, for trespassing in Lady Shar's temple.
Keep it - this is your problem, not mine.
Yet you seem no closer to retrieving the Nightsong? I read your notes - very interesting.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: |Flag Needed|  for searching Balthazar's MRT quarters

Text.Value: ...Hmm. Misplaced, it seems. You will be capable enough without it.
Ah... you're a leech. Interesting... but there's always room for improvement when it comes to the flesh.
Hatched, you say? That's novel, I'll admit, but still limiting. There's always room for improvement when it comes to the flesh.
Not so. Womb births are such imprecise things... There's always room for improvement when it comes to the flesh.
I could have, but decided not to - all the better for judging your mettle.
You, Z'rell, all the rest... you have only one body with which to serve. I have as many as I care to make.
You are a True Soul - there is no excuse for you to not recognise your betters.
You're sure you've read of a notable Balthazar before... But where?
As much as I enjoy you flattering me, this isn't my problem.
Though it's not all natural, is it? A touch of the divine... Most curious, for a True Soul.
This one's broken. He once tormented me as a youth, lifetimes ago. Now he serves me, forever.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Smiling fondly down at the damaged skeleton on the altar
EditorData.NodeContext: 'This guy used to pick on me. Now look at him'

Text.Value: There is a relic here. One which General Thorm desires. No - needs. I will retrieve it for him...
Attack.
Nere mentioned that you were seeking access to the Temple. Looks like you found it.
I take it the breaking of my skeletons was an accident - the living are so clumsy, after all.
What happened to your mother?
All right, I'll help you find the Nightsong.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player knows about Nightsong via Balthazar's research and previously revealed this to the necormancer.

Text.Value: No, I think I'll keep her.
No, I just decided to kill you instead.
Doesn't matter - I've already mapped out five escape routes. But I'll bite - who are you?
What exactly will you be doing while I'm out risking myself?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Question only available if the player hasn't yet agreed to help (for hasmet flow)

Text.Value: He didn't seem very legendary when I took his name - naught but a pile of bones. Impressive tomb, though.
No rest for you yet, Mikan. You will serve me until I am satisfied.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Leans down, whispers the line to the damaged skeleton, then straightens back up

Text.Value: Do you truly expect your betters to sully their hands to aid you at every turn, True Soul? Such a poor grasp of hierarchy...
I had Z'rell's permission - that good enough for you?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if Z'rell briefed the player and they had instructions to look in Balthazar's room in Moonrise

Text.Value: I think I'd rather exploit the Nightsong for myself - after I've gotten rid of you.
Judging by how you're cowering in here, your survival?
I received permission. Take it up with your peers at Moonrise, if you have an issue.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player did not have instructions to look in Balthazar's room in Moonrise

Text.Value: Finally, we can talk face-to-face.
Do you know what is at stake here?
It's been some time since anyone considered me a natural anything.
I was hatched in a crche and have fought ever since. What do you care of my gestation?
Naturally-born? That's a strange thing to hold against someone.
For jobs like this it's good form to provide your operatives some extra resources.
Sounds like you've good reason to be proud of the Nightsong - tell me more.
Take the bell.
About the orthon in these ruins - friend or foe to you?
Not just any True Soul would have succeeded in following my path through this place. You should be pleased.
...and he will come.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Balthazar holds up a small bell  and gives it a short ring, The flesh golem looks at it and gurgles with interest. <DAN>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar holds up a small bell  and gives it a short ring. The flesh golem looks at it and gurgles with interest.

Text.Value: ...Fine. Your usefulness may outweigh your insolence - for now. There are much grander things at stake.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Squints at the player, considering, before speaking.
EditorData.NodeContext: A pause before 'fine' - weighing up the player's fate.

Text.Value: I'm friendly. Z'rell sent me to make sure you weren't failing your master.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player knows of Balthazar from Z'rell

Text.Value: What the...? Give me back my mother, this instant!

EditorData.NodeContext: Briefly confused, then angry (player has taken the jar containing parts of his dead mother)

Text.Value: All right, I'll help you find this relic.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This question node if the player isn't aware of nightsong via Balthazar's research in MOO.

Text.Value: General Thorm...?
Touch me, and I'll strike you down with all of nature's fang and fury. Go ahead - try me.
Interesting, and private. Give me one reason why I shouldn't have my creations kill you right now, thief.
We're still close. She's in a jar on the shelf over there.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Cannot include shot of the jar - we cannot guarantee that it is still on the shelf

Text.Value: The Nightsong lends the General his strength, his invulnerability. It must be recovered, before his enemies attempt to exploit it.
Go, then - you'll either come to your senses, or die in this place without me.
Flesh will remain here until called. Don't fear, he has very sharp hearing - I chose his ears myself. Now, get to work.
The name Balthazar seems vaguely familar, but from where?
I said you'd be back. Reconsidered my proposition?
The name Balthazar seems familar, but not as a servant of Ketheric Thorm. Where have you heard it before?
Enlighten me.
*This necromancer has Ketheric's trust. Helping him could be just what you need to gain acccess to the man himself.*
But enough idle chatter - keep to the matter at hand. You do know what's at stake here, yes?
I recall tales of Balthazar the Monk - I must say, the legends don't do you justice.
Balthazar - I heard of a monk by that name once. He died a long time ago.
As you mention serving Ketheric, he sent you to find a relic, no?
Your creations? Mindless undead minions, from what I've seen.
Who are you?
*You remember an ancient scroll rescued from an Amkethran monastery. It spoke of Balthazar, the monastic order's leader. Specifically, it recorded his death.*
Actually, I have your mother.
Do not fail me, or you can share in Mikan's fate.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gestures at the broken skeleton on the altar beside him
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This node if the Necromancer referred to Mikan before

Text.Value: Something called the Nightsong. Your notes were very interesting.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: |Flag Needed|  for searching Balthazar's MRT quarters

Text.Value: Perhaps you'd be more useful dead than alive if you don't even know what I'm seeking here.
You didn't look deep enough. This will be your end, monster.
In part, yes - my poor unborn twin. Mother always resented me for it - said I strangled him in the womb, if you can believe such tripe.
Well, I'm not just a True Soul. I have some extraplanar help, so to speak.
The Nightsong is my finest creation - if I never exceed myself, I will still die happy. Not that I ever intend to do something as gauche as truly dying, of course.

EditorData.NodeContext: Peeved at the intrusion, but also proud of his work

Text.Value: Rubbish. Everything is at hand here - Z'rell merely envies the General's faith in me. I am in the midst of a grand strategy.
Wrong - no part of you will remain here when I'm finished with you.
Besides, once I developed my powers, I fetched him from the graveyard and brought him back - gave him a new, better body. Alas, mother was... not pleased.
That caterwauling beast is irrelevant as far as I'm concerned - unless he hampers my goals. In that case, consider him a foe, and act accordingly.
I'd trust this gasbag about as far as I can throw him - which isn't far. But perhaps better to play along, for now.
You and all the rest have only one body with which to serve. I have as many as I care to make.
I need more to go on. Why is this relic so important? What does it do?
Lady Shar forgive me... but I'll see what I can do to help.
I'll see what I can do.
Dull, dull, dull. Nere was never cut out to be a True Soul - he's a very obedient corpse, though.
Such a... limited grasp of mortality. Idiot.
I think I'd rather exploit this relic - after I've gotten rid of you.
You could have warned me about the orthon that was lurking in this place.
Balthazar - I heard of a monk by that name once. He died a long time ago.
I'm pleased to be of service, Balthazar.
...and you will help me. Ignorant you may be, you've shown some prowess in scouting and combat by making it this far.
My creations need tending to - not that it's any of your concern.
You will obey - once you are reborn as one of my creations.
Bold of you to assume I didn't destroy your skeletons deliberately.
I could break you quicker than you could squeak an order. Talk - who are you?
Fine, consider your merits acknowledged. Care to enlighten me as to what's going on?
Telling you will not make the task any less perilous. Just obey, and use your ignorance as a shield. You should be adept at that already.
Z'rell exceeds her authority. But fine, I'll overlook your transgressions this time - there are much grander things at stake.
Been prying into my research, then? What a devious piece of flesh you are. Consider yourself lucky that I have use for you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Displeased, but willing to let it go for the sake of the mission.

Text.Value: I hunt and kill monsters - such threats mean nothing to me. Talk - who are you?
Oh, him? Yes, I decided to take his name for myself after taking his rib bones. Suits me better, I think.
What do you need of me?
General Thorm to you. But yes, recovering the relic is the crux of it. He commands, and I, his humble servant, fulfil that command.

EditorData.NodeContext: First sentence spoken as a reprimand, for not referring to Ketheric Thorm with due deferrence.

Text.Value: My creations are more than a sum of their parts.
Sir, I am a jack-of-all-trades and a master of many. Our meeting was not by chance - you need me.
I think not. You seem a capable type, and I'll need to keep myself well-protected in this place.
My brother is no intellectual powerhouse, but he is strong, loyal and punctual. Should a fight turn against you, remember the bell.
Is it? I've seen inside your head, thanks to my troops. Besides, if you were an enemy, you'd be completely surrounded.
Promising flesh wasted on an idiot mind, I see. I'll salvage what parts I can from you.
Bold of you to assume I'm a comrade - considering you know of my god.
True Soul? Bold of you, to assume I'm a comrade.
Return Balthazar's mother.
Obey? No - I will smite you where you stand, necromancer.
I do not need you, or your help. But you are here in spite of that, so I may as well make use of you.

EditorData.stateContext: Golem bell no longer in Balthazar's hand (in player inventory)

Text.Value: Enough prattling. I'll show you what it is to truly command the dead. Then I'm sending you to join them.
You've fouled the name of mages long enough. I'll never let you leave this place alive, necromancer.
I'm not exactly 'living', technically speaking.
I was hatched in a crche and have fought ever since. What do you care of my gestation?
Naturally-born? That's a strange thing to hold against someone.
Good. And keep your hands to yourself in future.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cooling down (player has returned the jar containing his dead mother)

Text.Value: You expect your words to spark fear - but I am past such things. Who are you?
Wait. It - he - is your brother?
Not lost your nerve, I hope? I tend to remove those from my creations - too much fuss.
Another True Soul was looking for you. Nere - I aided him in the Underdark.
I gave you a chance, mother-thief!
Balthazar, I presume? Z'rell sent me. She thinks you're in danger of failing your master.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player received the Balthazar quest from Z'rell

Text.Value: A scout is little good if they don't know what to look for. What does this relic do?
Do not fail me. If you do, you'll join the ranks of my creations, and be forced to try again.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gestures at the broken skeleton on the altar beside him
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This node if the Necromancer did not refer to Mikan before

Text.Value: But you're here now, and I may be able to put those limbs to work. You know what's at stake here, I take it?
I never said I was going to help. This is your problem.
Who are you?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player didn't receive  the Balthazar quest from Z'rell

Text.Value: I wield the divine. I can use it to assist you, or send you screaming to the Fugue Plane. Your choice.
Give me the bell. I'll see what I can do.
So you need my help - what would I have to do?
The Nightsong is close, but the way is barred and Shar's dead are... uncooperative. Clear the path for me - by blade, cunning, or whatever it takes.
I'm not the type to make a deal without the details. What exactly am I looking for?
You're hiding from shadows - literally. Don't make threats you can't back up.
Z'rell spoke of a relic - something called the Nightsong in your notes. They were very interesting.

EditorData.stateContext: Golem bell is in Balthazar's hand

Text.Value: You're assuming I'm an ally. Unwise, perhaps.
I'll be pleased when I separate your head from your shoulders, necromancer.
Fine. I'll see what I can do. May Lady Shar forgive me for aiding you.
Fine. I'll see what I can do.
Jobs like this always go smoother when I know exactly what I'm looking for.
I fought a battle right under your nose - whoever you are, some help would have been useful.
I'll take that bell. It may prove useful.
Z'rell said Ketheric wants you to find a relic. That's all I know.
There's always a choice. Like I can let you live, or not.
You need my help?
*This necromancer has Ketheric's trust. Helping him might just be the best way to gain access to Moonrise Towers.*

EditorData.logicalname: NOT SENT TO MOONRISE BY JAHEIRA

Text.Value: This is not a problem - it is an opportunity. And it is not a choice either - you will obey.
*It comes back to you - Balthazar headed a monastic order that controlled a place called Amkethran, in the deserts of Calimshan... but he is long dead, from what you recall.*
You are a waste of flesh. I'll see what I can salvage, after my creations are through with you.
But never mind, your potential may outweigh your ignorance. I am Balthazar - Chief Advisor to General Thorm, and entrusted with a mission of utmost importance.
Leave.
Because I am magical powerhouse. You need me, and you know it.
And spoil the surprise? I think not. But let's just say that the Nightsong was a unique specimen even before I began my work...
Perhaps I will seek out his carcass, should I be afforded the opportunity. Surely there are some parts I could put to use...
Naturally-born? I don't know if it's true, but that's a novel insult.
I outmatch you in both brains and magic - you need me.
Neither. That caterwauling beast is irrelevant as far as I'm concerned - unless he hampers my goals. In that case, consider him a foe, and act accordingly.
The devil is of no relevance to my goal. Besides, it seems you handled him well enough - I no longer hear that blasted singing of his.
What are the properties of this relic, magical or otherwise? So I can be of better assistance, of course.
Let's assume I'm friendly. Who are you?
General Thorm trusts me. He knows I will deliver. He knows I will stand by him long after all others wilt and fall.
I fought a battle right under your nose - help would have been useful.
Perhaps you can prove to me that you're more useful alive than dead. You know what's at stake here, I take it?
Kill me? Death is my ally, fool.
You have resources to spare - give me something to aid my search.
I do not cower - I plan. I command. I create.
Liar. Liar and a waste of flesh. I'll see what I can salvage from you, after my creations are through with you.
Fine. I will assign Flesh to aid you on your way. Ring this bell...

EditorData.AnimationTags: Reaches behind his back for the bell  <DAN>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Reaches behind his back for the bell

Text.Value: You are a ship without a sail, necromancer. You need allies - you need me.
I will remain here until you have succeeded, or fallen.
They are mere sketches compared to my masterwork - that would leave you in awe, should you be fortunate enough to bear witness.
The miserable worm tried to kill me, hoping to take all the glory of this mission for himself.
Go, then. You'll be back, once you've had another taste of Shar's hospitality.

Synopsis: The player meets Balthazar, the necromancer, in his temporary command centre in the Shar temple. They find him at an altar, repairing one of his damaged undead, while other minions bustle around. Balthazar has been sent by Ketheric Thorm to recover Nightsong, but has been unable to clear a path to her vault. He decides to recruit the player, upon recognising them as tadpoled. The player can agree or decline, and can possibly persuade him to loan his flesh golem to aid their exploration.
